Address: 10.137.212.113

Additional Info:

==========================================

subject: Ability distinguish between user generated and our own uploaded photos within CMS

comments.value:
We'd like to be able to distinguish between user generated and 
our own uploaded photos within CMS

It not very generic but is there anyway we can distinguish a image with uploadedBy / let 2012 filter by them obv. billable work (although imagine a day is the absolute most they would pay for it). Is this something Janos could look at.

This needs to be a bit more tightly specified. Filtered where? In the global navigation, in the pictures filter menu, in the picker? How can they be distinguished anyway, ie what is the Finder filter criterion?

Hi,  can someone please clarify where we are with this?  I know that they are being identified, sort of, on the front end as user-generated b/c of the way they appear on the photo hub page (see attached).  But then the user information is missing on the photo page itself.  Is there a way to include that, somehow?

Also,  i think to answer Michael's question - what was requested is so once we've published a user photo, we could have some way of figuring out which photos are user-generated.  right now it just says that the owner is delstein, b/c she published it. the only way to tell is b/c we've tagged it 'user upload' and that we can see what folder it lives in (/useruploads).  It would be nice if it were a filter or something, so when we have more user photos, they don't 'clutter' the main picture view.

does that make more sense?
Erm, a filter where? Do you mean http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/files/pictures/ ?
Liz says: "Yeah, i think that's what we mean. So in the 'pictures' page in the CMS we want a 'filter' to show only those photos that are user generated. I think."
Set to high.

In the "Pictures" screen it would be difficult - and no doubt unusably unperformant - to filter on "uploadedByDisplayName" as this metadata is held on the photo page, not the image asset. However, the image's owner is set to the external user who submitted it. Would it suffice to display their email address in the screen or tooltip? 

I don't understand Liz's comment that "the user information is missing on the photo page itself" - isn't this what uploadedBy and uploadedByDisplayName are for? Or does she mean on the live site - if so, a separate issue should be opened for that unrelated task.

It would be really helpful if I had a better idea of what the *problem* is that we're trying to resolve here. What is the use case? What task(s) are 2012 staff finding it difficult to perform, and why? Might need to resort to the "5 whys" technique here :)

I believe I meant on the live site - there were two points to this 
1) editors ability to distinguish between ugc and our photos
1a) in the 'uploaded photos' area, there is no way to see the username of the person who sent the pic in?
2) the public to be able to distinguish between ugc and our photos. There is the 'your recently uploaded phtoos' box, but then on the photo page you lose the ability to see who it was posted by!

One-by-one:

1. Editors ability to distinguish between UGC and our photos.

I suggest the following two enhancements (and apologies for the slightly crude quality of the image mock-ups!)

i) Amend the picture editor to allow an extra filter to be specified. See "Pictures-with.png".

ii) Amend the image-picker, to allow a similar filter to be specified. See "Picket-without.png" and "Picker-with.png".

(These filters will include/exclude the "user uploads" section).

Estimate: 2/3 - 1 day.
Go for it!

1. Editors ability to distinguish between UGC and our photos. 

This is completed on dev, ready for deployment.

Time: 0.7 days (plus a one-off deployment when all of these items are deployed)

2. the public to be able to distinguish between ugc and our photos. There is the 'your recently uploaded phtoos' box, but then on the photo page you lose the ability to see who it was posted by! 

Can you check the following page, and see whether it looks ok please?
  http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/photos/user-photos/music-producer.php
In particular, note:
	Music Producer
	Uploaded by Jayanta Pathak
	13 Jul 2010

Does this look ok?

Hi Kieran,

We need the Uploaded by to show their username, not their full name!

That would be a big step in the right direction. Once we’ve got this we can turn to figuring out searching/filtering UGC only photos.

"Jayanta" is that fellow's first name, which is what we use in the absence of a "username" (by which I think you mean "displayName").
  http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/photos/user-photos/music-producer.php
Another example is:
  http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/photos/user-photos/coupe-d-europe-d-athletisme-d-annecy.php (first name "jamel")

Splendid. That’s fine! Just make sure we never display the surname.

Otherwise, I’m happy with this!

(2.) Has now upped time to 0.8.

Will shortly discuss 1a)

Liz> 1a) in the 'uploaded photos' area, there is no way to see the username of the person who sent the pic in?
Thanks. This is not now high priority, let’s focus on other stuff first.

haven't really got to grips with any of these things (are Kitsite bored or did you just shout at them?) - could we have a quick meeting to sum up changes sometime this week?! am now going to delete all postcms emails without trying to get my head around them : )
________________________________________

um, that was intended for liz!! 

context: just back from 2 week holiday and jetlagged : )

will leave liz to explain all the good work you seem to have done though...
note to self: Need to dbl-check on IE before deploying.
Checked on IE / windows
Done, pending deployment.
What will actually be deployed? (i.e. CSS, html, javascript, php...) I’m learning my way around change requests at the moment.

This is a change to the CMS, rather than to the code on the live website.
i.e. it is just a change to the image picker, visible only to locog editorial staff.
Lovely thank you. I thought we were talking showing name of user on the front end. Apols!
That change has already gone live (it got through before the change process was imposed).
Hoorah :-P
CMS changes are awaiting CMS-deployment.
deployed

Simon

From: Morag Reavley [mailto:Morag.Reavley@london2012.com]
Sent: 27 October 2010 09:39
To: Jamie Unwin; Danny Sofer; postcms@london2012.com
Cc: Simon Knowles; Jagdeep Bhambra; Duncan Elder
Subject: Travel Advice to Businesses functionality
Importance: High

Hello there

You are already working on the Travel Advice to Businesses pages for london2012.com to get them live for late November.

There is a second piece of work by M&C Saatchi we are considering for implementing in January - an interactive tool which would walk users through a series of questions and then allow them to download a personalised 'travel plan' based on their responses. An outline of this process is attached, together with wireframes.

We have been told that the interactivity is client side (JavaScript and php). We would wish these pages to be built in the CMS so content can be managed.

What we need from you by Friday morning is a sense of:
Is this achievable in our CMS?
Is there anything M&C are proposing which you don't like or believe to be advisable?
How much time will this take you to implement and what is the cost?
What would you require from M&C Saatchi to smooth this process (more information, coding)?

Grateful for your thoughts.

Many thanks

Morag

subject: Postcode data

comments.value:
Hello

Do you recall the postcode data that we use to do look-ups of regions based on postcodes?

I need to be able to determine London Borough based on people's postcodes. Can you help with the following questions:
1. Does our ONS dataset contain London borough / postcode information?
2. How long would it take to assign London boroughs based on postcode data against all of our London records? This need not be a permanent fix (although in the longer term it would be nice to have this information) - I am looking for being able to pull out all the records we have in the five Olympic host boroughs (Hackney, Newham, Tower Hamlets, Walthamstow, Greenwich) by Wednesday next week. 

Or am I wishing for the stars as usual? :-)
Marked as high.
Sorry Kieran, I should have mentioned this on the call earlier. I hope you don't mind if I park this with you.

Hi Morag.
We should be able to do this.
Because of the volume of data, though, it's not exactly trivial.
I would estimate about 3 days however it might take even longer (up to 5 days) if the updating all of the existing users takes longer than anticipated.
Please let me know whether this is ok.
Kieran

Hi Kieran

When you say ‘should be able to do this’ – do you mean add borough permanently to the website so it’s automatically looked up whenever a new user joins? Or do you mean just run through the existing data on a one-off basis?

Morag

I mean adding borough permanently to the system, so it's automatically looked up for new users.

The actual difference - in terms of the amount of work for me - is very small.
In fact, I think that in order to do the borough lookups on a one-off basis, I would actually end up doing it as if on a permanent basis (because it would fit much more neatly into the infrastructure), and then disable it moving forward (if - for some reason - you didn't want it, moving forward).

The bulk of the work is: getting the postcode data into a state whereby we can look up london boroughs, and actually performing those lookups/updates on existing users.

I hope this makes sense!

Yes, perfect sense, thank you.

Kieran, I would like you to proceed please, since I think this will be more and more important going forwards as we seek to segment our database.

Thanks

Note to self:
Deploy new postcode server on dev.
Rhino. Needs to do:
  work out gor & boro, then call:
  update(false/*noworkflow*/);
dbl-check that wf state isn't changed.
How long will it take?
Amend workflow.
Test.
Deploy to milo.
Janos, re. Communicator Core/Corps ?

Time so far: 1 day.

Kieran's bit finished.
Time so far: 2.5 days.
Janos to do: .5 days.

Janos, I think you just need to add "londonBorough" to Communicator , and dbl-check that the feed picks it up. I think - after our conversations - that the feed will automatically supply fields if we have a same-named field in the cms?
I've started the monthly feed, which is to update londonBorough fields in all records on CC. (will be completed in 2-3 days)
Janos, can I mark as solved or do you want to wait until all the records have been updated?
Nnna. After various detours, CC now has up-to-date data.
Fabulous - thanks!
Marking as solved.

comments.value:
Dear Customer,

With regards to the above outstanding trouble ticket, we are currently awaiting confirmation from yourself that the issue has been cleared.

======================================

An issue regarding the host olympic-web03 was first brought to our attention by an alert for higher than usual load on the host. An attempt was made to restart the web server on the host to alleviate this load, however we were initially unable to bring up the web server instance responsible for accepting requests for the URL https://www.london2012.com due to a requirement for an SSL passphrase. The issue was escalated internally at IPsoft, after which the passphrase was determined and fed into the web server to bring the web instance for https://www.london2012.com up on the host.

For the entire duration of the issue, five other hosts (olympic-web01, olympic-web02, olympic-web04, olympic-web05, olympic-web06) were accepting traffic for the URL https://www.london2012.com . At no time for the duration of the issue was access to https://www.london2012.com impacted. All six hosts have been accepting traffic for that URL since Sunday, October 17th 11:00AM GMT.

======================================
Kindly check and confirm us the closure.


The trouble ticket will be closed if no response is received within 3 days.

If you require any further assistance, please contact the Service Desk on 0800 731 1713 or via email to ah.support@bt.com

Regards,

subject: Ticketing splash page go-live tomorrow

comments.value:
Hello

Just to confirm the details for tomorrow's splash page go-live:

The page should go live at 11.30am tomorrow but not before. I know you can't time to a minute when a page publishes and replicates across the servers, so can you work on the principle of getting the page live at 11.30am or as soon as possible after that, but no earlier, as the Ticketing site managed by Ticketmaster won't be live until 11.30am.

If anything goes wrong e.g. the press conference is late starting, I will let you know asap.

Many thanks for your work on this!

Hi Jag,

current set-up, but not sure if I should go through you or someone direct.

Could you let me know and who I should liaise with @ Kitsite.

Thanks

Dom

Hi Dom

These are the main areas on the site (that I can think of, *this may not be an exhaustive list*) where users POST form data.

Hope this helps, let me know if there is any other information you need.

Jamie

1) Registration (all in /settings)

	a) signup : /settings/login.php
	b) register : /settings/register.php
	c) reset password: /settings/reset-password.php
	d) set password: /settings/authenticate.php
	e) change password : /settings/password.php
	f) edit profile: /settings/edit-profile.php
	g) unsubscribe : /settings/unsubscribe.php

2) Search

	a) main search : /search.php
	b) blog search: /blog/search.php
	c) image search: /image/search.php
	d) video search: /videos/search.php
	e) event search: /get-involved/upcoming-events/index.php

3) User image upload 

     /photos/upload.php

     $allowedFiletypes = 'jpg jpeg pjpeg png x-png gif';
     $max_filesize = 1048576; #bytes

4) Map search

	/map.php

5) Blog and Photo commenting

	/php/post-comment.php

6) Photo rating

	/photos/includes/rate.php



Jamie

comments.value: On the videos hub page I just tried to 'Search by date' - this produces no results, either on 'Past month' or 'Past year'. Please can you investigate?
Confirmed. Marked as high.

It is because the default text "Search" gets added to the querystring.
  http://www.london2012.com/videos/search.php?x=24&y=9
works fine but
  http://www.london2012.com/videos/search.php?q=Search&x=24&y=9
doesn't.
We will need to make a small amendment the Search results template.
Technically, we should push this through the (not-yet-existent) change control procedure.
I'm not 100% sure of the rules but ... with your permission, I it might be ok to publish this (relatively minor) fix to a (relatively annoying) bug.
(I stress, I'm not sure of the rules here though so I don't want this to be interpreted as an attempt to circumvent the well-intended change-control procedure!).

Sigh. It’s exactly this kind of small but untidy bug which is going to suffer under our new change request process.

Can I think about this?
Of course.

Hey Lars.
Fwding this to you.
It's a simple fix, but you're not allowed to deploy it!
Can you fix it on dev please?
NB I've got dev publishing to the staging server at the moment, so when you make your changes (and publish them) they'll be visible here:
  http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/

Any questions, just ask.

lars to fix, on dev.
morag/other to preview, double-check that fix is ok.
someone to decide whether BT need to test on staging server.
change to be applied to live cms / live website
0.5 days

Came across a second problem which was the form age dropdown itself!

Fixed, please check and comfirm: http://london2012dev.kitsite.com/videos/
Time spent: 0.3 

Lars
Hmm, ‘past year’ search works, but not ‘past month’?

Its just there are no Video uploads in the last month ( maybe that is because of dev ) ~ The last
ones showing are from July. I reckon it should work though.

Oh, okay.

I should create a Change Request form before we push this live.

Will do so now and let you know when we can publish.

Thanks!
Great!
Change requested logged – please proceed to roll out.
Rolled out, alive and tested.
Looks great – thank you very much
